summary.long: Hosea is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The word of the Lord that came to Hosea son of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord first spoke by Hosea, the Lord said to Hosea: “Go, take for yourself a wife of harlotry and children of harlotry, for the land has committed great harlotry, departing from the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim as a wife. She conceived, and bore him a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to him: “Call his name Jezreel, for in a little while, I will punish the house of Jehu for the blood of Jezreel, and will bring to an end the kingdom of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day, I will break the bow of Israel in the Valley of Jezreel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Gomer conceived again, and bore a daughter. And the Lord said to Hosea: “Call her name Lo-Ruhamah, for I will no longer have mercy upon the house of Israel but will utterly sweep them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will have mercy upon the house of Judah, and will save them by the Lord their God, and will not save them by bow, or by sword, or by battle, or by horses, or by horsemen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Gomer had weaned Lo-Ruhamah, she conceived, and bore a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said: “Call his name Lo-Ammi, for you are not My people, and I am not your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the number of the children of Israel will be as the sand of the sea, which cannot be measured nor numbered. And in the place where it was said to them, “You are not My people,” there it will be said to them, “You are the children of the living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then will the Judahites and the children of Israel be gathered together, and appoint themselves one head, and they will come up out of the land, for great will be the day of Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to your brothers, Ammi, and to your sisters, Ruhamah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plead with your mother, plead—
    for she is not My wife,
    and am I not her husband—
that she put away her harlotry from her face,
    and her adultery from between her breasts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest I strip her naked
    and leave her as in the day that she was born,
and turn her into a wilderness,
    and turn her into a dry land,
    and kill her with thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not have mercy upon her children,
    for they are children of harlotry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their mother has played the whore.
    She that conceived them has acted shamefully.
For she said, “I will pursue my lovers,
    who provide my bread and my water,
    my wool and my flax, my oil and my drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, behold, I will hedge up your way with thorns,
    and make a wall, so that she will not find her paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She will pursue her lovers, but she will not reach them;
    and she will seek them but will not find them.
Then she will say,
    “I will go and return to my first husband,
    for it was better for me then than now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But she did not know that it was I who provided her
    the grain, the wine, and the oil,
and multiplied her silver and gold
    that they used for Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will take back My grain in its time
    and My wine in its season,
and I will recover My wool and My flax,
    given to cover her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will uncover her shame
    in the sight of her lovers,
    and no one will deliver her from My hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also bring to an end all her joy,
    her annual feasts, her New Moons,
    and her Sabbaths, and all her solemn assemblies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will destroy her vines and her fig trees,
    of which she has said, “These are my rewards that my lovers have given me.”
I will make them a forest,
    and the beasts of the field will eat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will punish her for the days of the Baals,
    when she burned incense to them
and adorned herself with her earrings and her jewelry,
    and pursued her lovers,
    but forgot Me,
    declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, I will allure her,
    and bring her into the wilderness,
    and speak tenderly to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From there, I will give her vineyards to her,
    and the Valley of Achor as a door of hope.
She will respond there as in the days of her youth,
    and as in the day when she came up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On that day, declares the Lord,
    you will call Me, “My husband,”
    and will no longer call Me, “My Baal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will remove the names of the Baals from her mouth,
    and they will no longer be remembered by their name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On that day, I will make a covenant for them
    with the beasts of the field, with the fowls of heaven,
    and with the creeping things of the ground.
I will break the bow and the sword and the battle
    from the earth,
    and will make them to lie down safely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will take you for My wife forever.
    I will take you for My wife in righteousness and in justice,
    in mercy and in compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will take you for My wife in faithfulness,
    and you will know the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On that day I will answer,
    declares the Lord;
I will answer the heavens,
    and they will answer the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will sow her for Myself in the earth.
    I will have mercy upon Lo-Ruhamah,
and I will say to Lo-Ammi, “You are My people,”
    and they will say, “You are my God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Go, again, love a woman who is loved by a lover and is committing adultery, just as the Lord loves the children of Israel, who look to other gods and love raisin cakes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I purchased her for myself for fifteen shekels of silver, and for a homer of barley, and a half homer of barley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to her, “You will remain with me many days. You will not play the whore, and you will not belong to another man. And also I will be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the children of Israel will remain many days without a king and without a prince, without a sacrifice and without a standing stone, and without an ephod and teraphim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward the children of Israel will return and seek the Lord their God and David their king. They will come in fear to the Lord and to His goodness in the latter days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the word of the Lord, O children of Israel,
    for the Lord has a dispute
    with the inhabitants of the land:
There is no truth or mercy,
    and no knowledge of God in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Swearing, lying, and killing,
    and stealing and adultery
break out,
    and bloodshed follows bloodshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the land dries up,
    and everyone who lives in it withers
with the beasts of the field
    and the birds of the sky;
    even the fish of the sea disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet let no one contend,
    and let none reprove another,
for your people are like those
    that contend with a priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will stumble in the day,
    and the prophet also will stumble with you in the night,
and I will destroy your mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge. 
Because you have rejected knowledge,
    I will reject you from being My priest.
And because you have forgotten the law of your God,
    I will also forget your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As they increased, so they sinned against Me.
    I will change their glory into shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They feed upon the sin of My people,
    and they are greedy for their iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be like people, like priest.
    I will punish them for their ways
    and reward them for their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will eat, but not be satisfied;
    they will play the whore, but not multiply,
because they have forsaken the Lord
by devoting themselves to
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My people seek counsel from their wood,
    and their staff informs them.
For the spirit of harlotry has led them astray,
    and they have played the whore in defiance of their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sacrifice upon the tops of the mountains,
    and burn incense upon the hills
under oak, poplar, and elm
    because their shade is good.
Therefore your daughters play the whore,
    and your daughters-in-law commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not punish your daughters
    when they play the whore,
nor your daughters-in-law
    when they commit adultery.
For the men separate themselves with whores,
    and they sacrifice with cult prostitutes.
    A people without understanding will come to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though you play the whore, O Israel,
    do not let Judah offend. 
Do not come to Gilgal,
    or go up to Beth Aven,
    and do not swear, “As the Lord lives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a stubborn heifer,
    Israel is stubborn.
Now will the Lord feed them
    like a lamb in a wide pasture?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim is joined to idols;
    let him alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their drink has soured,
    they have played the whore continually.
    Her rulers dearly love shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wind has wrapped her in its wings,
    and they will be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, O priests!
    Pay attention, O house of Israel!
Listen, O house of the king!
    For the judgment is for you,
because you have been a snare at Mizpah
    and a net spread over Tabor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and a pit dug deep in Shittim;
    but I will discipline them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know Ephraim,
    and Israel is not hidden from Me;
for now, O Ephraim, you have played the whore.
    Israel is defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The pride of Israel testifies against him.
    Israel and Ephraim stumble in their iniquity.
    Judah also stumbles with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With their flocks and their herds they will go
    to seek the Lord,
but they will not find Him.
    He has withdrawn from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have dealt faithlessly with the Lord,
    for they have given birth to illegitimate children.
Now the New Moon will devour them
    along with their portion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blow the horn in Gibeah,
    and the trumpet in Ramah.
Cry aloud at Beth Aven,
    “Look behind you, O Benjamin!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim will become desolate
    in the day of punishment.
Among the tribes of Israel
    I make known that which is sure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The princes of Judah have become
    like those who remove a boundary marker.
Upon them I will pour out
    My wrath like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim is oppressed
    and broken in judgment,
    because he eagerly followed after vanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will be like pus to Ephraim
    and like rottenness to the house of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Ephraim saw his sickness
    and Judah saw his wound,
then Ephraim went to Assyria,
    and sent to King Jareb.
Yet he cannot cure you
    or heal your wound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will be like a lion to Ephraim
    and like a young lion to the house of Judah.
I, Myself, will tear and go away.
    I will carry off, and no one will rescue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will again return to My place
    until they acknowledge their offense
and seek My face.
    In their affliction they will earnestly seek Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, let us return to the Lord,
for He has torn,
    and He will heal us.
He has struck,
    and He will bind us up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After two days He will revive us.
    On the third day He will raise us up,
    that we may live before Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us know, let us press on to know the Lord.
    His appearance is as sure as the dawn.
He will come to us like the rain;
    like the spring rains He will water the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What shall I do to you, O Ephraim?
    What shall I do to you, O Judah?
Your faithfulness is like a morning cloud,
    and like the early dew it goes away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I have hewn them by the prophets.
    I have killed them by the words of My mouth,
    and My judgments go forth like light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I desired mercy, and not sacrifice,
    and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But like men they have transgressed the covenant.
    There they dealt faithlessly with Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gilead is a city of evildoers,
    polluted with blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As robbers lie in wait for someone,
    so a company of priests
murder on the way to Shechem.
    They commit a shameful deed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen a horrible thing
    in the house of Israel.
The harlotry of Ephraim is there;
    Israel is defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also, O Judah, a harvest is appointed for you,
    when I restore the fortunes of My people.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
but they did not consider in their hearts
    that I remember all their wickedness.
Now their own deeds surround them;
    they are before My face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They make the king glad with their wickedness,
    and the princes with their lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are all adulterers,
    like an oven heated by a baker,
who ceases stirring the fire
    after kneading the dough until it is leavened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the day of our king the princes made him sick
    from the heat of wine.
    He stretched out his hand with scorners.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They are all hot as an oven,
    and they devour their judges.
All their kings have fallen,
    and none of them calls to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim mixes himself with the people.
    Ephraim is a cake not turned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Foreigners devour his strength,
    but he does not know it.
Gray hairs are here and there upon him,
    but he does not know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The pride of Israel testifies against him,
    but they do not return to the Lord their God,
    nor seek Him for all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim is like a dove,
    silly and without sense;
they call to Egypt,
    they go to Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to them,
    for they have fled from Me!
Destruction to them,
    for they have rebelled against Me!
Though I would redeem them,
    yet they speak lies against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They do not cry to Me with their heart
    when they howl on their beds.
They gather together for grain and wine,
    they rebel against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I trained and strengthened their arms,
    yet they devise mischief against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They return, but not to the Most High.
    They are like a loose bow.
Their princes will fall by the sword
    for the rage of their tongue.
This will be their derision
    in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set the trumpet to your mouth!
    One like an eagle is on the house of the Lord,
because they have transgressed My covenant
    and rebelled against My law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel cries to Me,
    “My God, we know You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel has cast off the good;
    the enemy will pursue him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They set up kings, but not through Me;
    they made princes, but I did not know it.
With their silver and gold,
    they made idols,
    so that they will be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your calf, O Samaria, is rejected!
    My anger is kindled against them.
How long will they be incapable of innocence?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is from Israel;
a craftsman made it,
    and it is not God!
The calf of Samaria
    will be broken to pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they sow the wind,
    and they will reap the whirlwind.
The standing grain has no head
    and will yield no flour.
If it were to yield,
    foreigners would swallow it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel is swallowed up.
    Now they are among the nations
    as a vessel in which there is no pleasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Though they hire among the nations,
    I will now gather them.
They will begin to diminish due to the burden
    of the king of princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because Ephraim has multiplied altars for sin,
    they have become to him altars for sinning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have written for him the great things of My law,
    but they were regarded as a strange thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sacrifices of My offerings,
    they sacrifice flesh and eat it;
    but the Lord does not accept them.
Now He will remember their iniquity
    and punish their sins.
    They will return to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel has forgotten his Maker
    and built temples,
    and Judah has multiplied fortified cities;
so I will send a fire upon his cities,
    and it will devour his palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not rejoice, O Israel!
    Do not exult like the peoples,
for you have played the whore departing from your God.
    You have loved a prostitute’s wages
    on every threshing floor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The threshing floor and the winepress will not feed them,
    and the new wine will fail in her.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
What will you do on the appointed day,
    and on the day of the festival of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For indeed they are gone because of destruction.
    Egypt will gather them,
    and Memphis will bury them.
Nettles will possess their pleasant things of silver,
    and thorns will be in their tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The watchman of Ephraim is a prophet
    for my God;
yet a fowler’s snare is on all his ways,
    and hatred in the house of his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have deeply corrupted themselves
    as in the days of Gibeah.
He will remember their iniquity,
    He will punish their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like grapes in the wilderness,
    I found Israel.
Like the first fruit on the fig tree in its first season,
    I saw your fathers.
But they went to Baal Peor
    and consecrated themselves to a thing of shame,
    and they became an abomination like the thing they loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird:
    no birth, no pregnancy, no conception!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though they bring up their children,
    I will bereave them until none are left.
Woe to them indeed,
    when I depart from them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just as I saw Ephraim like Tyre,
    planted in a pleasant place,
so now Ephraim will bring out
    his children for slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give them, O Lord—
    what will You give?
Give them a miscarrying womb
    and dry breasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All their wickedness is in Gilgal,
    for there I hated them.
Because of the wickedness of their deeds,
    I will drive them out of My house.
I will love them no more.
    All their princes are rebels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim is stricken,
    their root is dried up,
    they shall bear no fruit.
Even though they give birth,
    I will slay the beloved offspring of their womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My God will reject them
    because they did not listen to Him,
    and they will be wanderers among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel is a fertile vine
    that brings forth its fruit.
As his fruit multiplied,
    so his altars increased;
as his land prospered,
    so he improved his pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their heart is divided;
    now they must bear their guilt.
He will break down their altars
    and destroy their pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For now they will say,
    “We have no king,
because we do not fear the Lord;
    and a king, what could he do for us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They speak mere words,
    swearing falsely
    in making a covenant.
Thus judgment springs up like a poisonous plant
    in the furrows of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The inhabitants of Samaria fear
    because of the calf of Beth Aven.
For its people mourn for it,
    and its priests shriek for it,
    because its glory has departed from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be carried to Assyria
    as a tribute to King Jareb.
Ephraim shall be put to shame,
    and Israel shall be ashamed of his idol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for Samaria, her king will perish
    like a twig on the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The high places of Aven, the sin of Israel,
    will be destroyed.
Thorn and thistle will grow
    on their altars.
They will say to the mountains, Cover us,
    and to the hills, Fall on us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, you have sinned since the days of Gibeah.
    There they have continued.
Will not the war in Gibeah against evildoers
    overtake them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I desire, I will punish them.
    The nations will be gathered against them
    when they are disciplined for their two transgressions.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You have plowed wickedness.
    You have reaped iniquity,
    and you have eaten the fruit of lies.
Because you have trusted in your power
    and in the numbers of your warriors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
therefore a tumult will arise among your people,
    and all your fortresses will be destroyed
as Shalman destroyed Beth Arbel in the day of battle;
    mothers were dashed to pieces upon their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So will it be done to you, O Bethel,
    because of your great wickedness.
At dawn
    the king of Israel will be utterly cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Israel was a child, I loved him,
    and out of Egypt I called My son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As I called them,
    so they went from Me.
They sacrificed to the Baals
    and burned incense to idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I taught Ephraim to walk,
    taking them up in My arms,
but they did not know
    that I healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I drew them with cords of human kindness,
    with bands of love.
I was to them as those who ease the yoke on their neck,
    and I bent down and fed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will return to the land of Egypt,
    and Assyria will be his king,
    because they refused to return to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sword slashes in their cities,
    consumes their oracle-priests,
    and devours because of their own counsels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people are bent on backsliding from Me.
    Though they called to the Most High,
    none at all exalt Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can I give you up, Ephraim?
    How can I hand you over, Israel?
How can I make you like Admah?
    How can I treat you like Zeboyim?
My heart churns within Me;
    My compassion is stirred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not execute the fierceness of My anger;
    I will not again destroy Ephraim.
For I am God, and not man,
    the Holy One in your midst,
    and I will not come in wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will walk after the Lord,
    who roars like a lion.
When He roars,
    His children will come trembling from the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will come trembling
    like a bird out of Egypt
    and like a dove from the land of Assyria.
And I will let them dwell in their houses,
    says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim has surrounded Me with lies,
    and the house of Israel with deceit.
But Judah still walks with God,
    and is faithful to the Holy One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim feeds on the wind
    and chases after the east wind all day long.
    He multiplies lies and devastation.
They make a covenant with Assyria,
    and oil is carried to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has a dispute with Judah,
    and will punish Jacob according to his ways,
    and repay him according to his doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the womb, he took his brother by the heel,
    and by his strength he strove with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He struggled with the angel, and prevailed;
    he wept, and sought favor from Him.
He found Him in Bethel,
    and there He spoke with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for the Lord the God of Hosts,
    the Lord is the name by which He is invoked!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for you, return to your God,
    hold fast to mercy and justice,
    and wait on your God continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A merchant, in whose hands are deceitful balances,
    he loves to oppress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim said,
    “Yet I am rich, I have found wealth for myself.
In all my labors, they shall find no offense in me
    that would be sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the Lord your God
    from the land of Egypt.
I will again make you to dwell in tents,
    as in the days of the appointed feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have spoken by the prophets,
    and I have multiplied visions,
    and through the prophets I will bring destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In Gilead there is iniquity;
    surely they will come to nothing.
In Gilgal they sacrifice bulls,
    so their altars will be like stone heaps
    in the furrows of the fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jacob fled to the land of Aram,
    and Israel served for a wife,
    and for a wife he kept sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By a prophet the Lord brought Israel up from Egypt,
    and by a prophet he was preserved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim provoked Him to anger most bitterly,
    so his Lord shall leave his bloodguilt on him
    and repay him for his reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When Ephraim spoke, trembling,
    he was exalted in Israel.
    But he incurred guilt through Baal worship and he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And now they continue sinning
    and have made a cast image for themselves,
idols of their silver, according to their understanding;
    all of them the work of craftsmen.
They say of them,
    “Those who sacrifice
    are kissing calves!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore they will be like the morning cloud,
    or like the early dew that passes away,
    like chaff blown off the threshing floor,
    or like the smoke from a chimney.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I am the Lord your God
    ever since the land of Egypt.
You know no God but Me,
    and there is no savior besides Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I knew you in the wilderness,
    in the land of great drought.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So I will be like a lion to them,
    like a leopard I will lurk by the path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will attack them like a bear bereaved of her cubs,
    and will tear open their rib cage.
There I will devour them like a lion,
    as the wild beast would tear them to pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, you are destroyed,
    but in Me is your help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where now is your king
    that he may save you in all your cities?
And where are your judges of whom you said,
    “Give me a king and princes”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I gave you a king in My anger,
    and took him away in My wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up;
    his sin is stored up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The pains of childbirth come for him.
    He is an unwise son,
for he does not present himself
    at the opening of the womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will ransom them from the power of Sheol.
    I will redeem them from Death.
O Death, where are your plagues?
    O Sheol, where is your sting? 
Compassion is hidden from My eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though he be fruitful among his brothers,
the east wind will come, a wind of the Lord,
    rising from the wilderness.
And his spring shall become dry,
    his fountain shall be dried up.
It shall plunder his treasury
    of every desirable thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Samaria will be held guilty,
    for she has rebelled against her God.
They will fall by the sword,
    their infants will be dashed to pieces,
    and their pregnant women will be ripped open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return, O Israel, to the Lord your God,
    for you have stumbled because of your iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take words with you
    and return to the Lord.
Say to Him,
    “Take away all iniquity,
and accept that which is good;
    and we will offer the fruit of our lips!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Assyria will not save us,
    we will not ride on horses.
We will no longer say, ‘Our God,’
    to the work of our hands.
    In You the orphan finds mercy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will be like the dew to Israel;
    he shall grow like the lily
and shall strike his roots
    like Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His branches will spread out,
and his beauty shall be like the olive tree,
    and his fragrance like that of Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those that dwell under his shadow will return,
    they will flourish like the grain
and grow as a vine.
    Their fragrance will be like the wine of Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Ephraim, what have I to do with idols?
    It is I who answer and look after him.
I am like a green fir tree;
    your fruit is found in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
